## Philosophy Alignment

<!-- Ensure your changes align with library principles -->

- [ ] **Generic**: Technology-agnostic (doesn't favor specific tools)
- [ ] **Evidence-based**: No assumptions without verification
- [ ] **Stable**: Long-lasting principles, not temporary trends
- [ ] **Practical**: Includes real-world examples
- [ ] **Complete**: Cross-referenced with related components

## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with 'x' -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review
- [ ] I have commented my code where necessary
- [ ] All code examples include tests (where applicable)
- [ ] Code examples follow TDD principles (Red → Green → Refactor)

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation
- [ ] README.md updated (if structure changed)
- [ ] CHANGELOG.md updated under `[Unreleased]`
- [ ] Cross-references added to related files
- [ ] Examples provided for new concepts

### Testing

- [ ] All code examples tested locally
- [ ] Links validated (internal and external)
- [ ] Markdown linting passed
- [ ] No broken references

### Git Hygiene

- [ ] Branch name follows convention (feature/, fix/, docs/, refactor/)
- [ ] Commits follow Conventional Commits format
- [ ] Commit messages are clear and descriptive
- [ ] No merge commits (rebased on main)
